page.title: 17Education: Kettering N.E.
page.content: Stamford Road (A43) is the border between the catchment areas of Grange Primary and Avondale Infant and Junior Schools. Grange Primary School was built to serve the new estate and opened at Easter 1957. Since its establishment the school has had 2 heads; the present one since 1977. A nursery unit is to be opened this year (1985) and it will be an integral part of the school. The Head sees nursery provision as being of vital importance as many of the very young children in the area require some real security before they begin their statutory schooling. The school enjoys good support from the parents and those who belong to the Friends association. Usually a third of children proceed to Henry Gotch Comprehensive and others to Kettering Boys, Southfield or Montagu schools as allocated.
